posts.post_content:
Is it too soon to start begging for more?
I just bought 11 of these cool cards last week, now I *need* a bunch more to satisfy my sickness. I havent started a new set in a while...(haven't finished one either:rolleyes: )

Looking for mid to low grades...I'd be willing to pay a bit more for SGC graded ones, but raw or psa would work too...just about any card will do. Small lots even better!

Gee Richard, I kinda knew this would happen:o

have an SGC 30 Brockett; let me know if you would like scans/price. can be reached at:
[url]shoelessjoe_in_hof@msn.com[/url]
thanks,
jim

Jim...thanks for writing...Brockett was among the 11 cards i bought last week:(
I guess i should create a wantlist in case this keeps happening:D

I appreciate the offer nonetheless

[quote name="familytoad" post=866367]I appreciate the offer nonetheless[/QUOTE]

I make no apologies, Brian ;)  It's a great set.  Just challenging enough to keep it interesting, and priced just reasonably enough to keep it affordable.  Of course there are some exceptions...Without a little luck, you'll have to pay aggressively for any player from Baltimore, as well as Gandil, Taylor and possibly Kelley.

I still have my Toronto sub-set [13 cards].  Once I upgrade a couple, I am thinking about making a wall-hung display for them.

Good luck with the set!

Regards,

Richard.
